Lines: ...I don’t know.
No.
No I didn’t.
No.
No.
He did?
Why would he say that?
[now pissed] Well, I've gotta go over there and-
Okay. [flips Tweek off]
Red Racer's on.
I do watch Red Racer every day of the week!
Nope. [shuts the door]
What?! What did he say about Stripe?!
That son of a bitch, I'll kill him!
After Red Racer.
Dad, I'm supposed to get in a fight tomorrow.
Some kid.
Yeah, don't just "Oh" me!
I uh...
[turns to the crowd] What do we do?
I've never been in a fight before.
Meatloaf?
Oh, Jesus! I can't take it! Stop!
How can I resist an ass so great?
This ass is unlike any I've encountered, Master. [Cartman bumps him off the ring, he hits a wall, and he's out]
Okay.
Okay, okay!
Respect my authority.
Ugh.
What was on the news?
Huh?
I'm gonna kick your ass!
This girl touched my thigh.
Um... [Gerald whispers in his ear] Okay. I refuse to answer on the grounds that it may incinerate me.
Incriminate.
Hey, kid. Get out of that hamster ball.
Just get out of the hamster ball, or else you're gonna find out!
Have a nice second half of the day, nerdo!
[leading a group of boys, walks up] Enjoying your lunch, nerdo?
Get him! [the group grabs him and duct-tapes him to an adjacent bench, then walks away.]
Alright, here's the plan. Tomorrow night at the dance, when none of the chaperones are looking, you guys go grab Mark. Bring him out here, and then we're gonna duct-tape him to this flagpole.
That's the point, buttpipe.
["-becoming of me?"] Hey, there he is! There's the home-schooled kid! [Mark enters and stands next to Kyle] Come on! Let's go duct-tape him to the flagpole! ["Ride the tiger."]
Oh my God!
[grabbing Mark's right hand] No! He's my friend!
No, you don't!
[approaches] What?
You... sure you wanna go to Treasure Cove?
[stops just short of the line] This is the end of Smiley Town. The only phone is somewhere in Treasure Cove. If you wanna find it, you're gonna have to cross the white line.
Hell no! I'm not crossing the white line.
Craig.
It's Spaceman Craig. [walks away slowly, deliberately, making sci-fi sound effects as he walks. Linda and her husband look at each other baffled. They then walk forward...]
[space helmet off] Take that, kindergartners!
[space helmet back on] Kindergartners. Treasure Cove is full of them.
I got new orders. I'm supposed to take you to see the mayor.

Episode Title: How to Eat with Your Butt
Lines: ...Come on, we wanna see the ass people.
Don't you have a VHS of it?

[walks past Tolkien, behind Butters] Ha, that guy's a pussy. [drags a sled behnd him. On the sled is Kenny, dead and badly beat up, with his right eye hanging out of its socket. Tweek and Clyde bring up the rear, and Tolkien looks as they leave him behind]
Oh, aaaah, well you guys are dumb.
[entering] What's going on?
Oh. [leaves]
I don't know. Why?
Yeah. It kinda does. [Bebe continues writing, but stops and looks to her right. All the boys are looking at her, all the girls look at the board.]
[beats his chest] Urh urh urh! [all the boys start grunting and displaying aggression]
That's true, huh? Man, that really makes me reflect on my pets.
Well, yeah, but Wendy, you have to admit, Bebe's a lot smarter and more organized than you.
Yeah!
Sure is!
Hah hah hahah hah! [the other boys turn and start grunting. Stan chases Craig away from the steps, then returns to sitting there.]
Have you guys noticed that Bebe isn't as cool as she used to be? [Bebe smiles at her uncoolness]
I'm sorry for fighting, you guys. [all the boys leave their seats and start apologizing to each other, hugging each other]

Episode Title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
Lines: It could hold a mental spell of some kind.

Episode Title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
Lines: There's no alternative. We have to return the tape before it causes more damage!

Episode Title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
Lines: Ha! We cannot trust something of that much power to a dwarf! Especially a kindergartner dwarf. [all the boys begin to chatter, nominating who should return the video]

Episode Title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
Lines: You're too young.

Episode Title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
Lines: Only the six of us are to go?

Episode Title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
Lines: Look out! [a small avalanche of snow appears in front of them]

Episode Title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
Lines: We're entering the limits of Bailey. Everyone stay close.

Episode Title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
Lines: What? That's stupid.

Episode Title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
Lines: Whatever. I'm going back to play with the Harry Potter kids. [walks off]
Yeah, didn't you see that commercial where it says that if you have pot you could become a terrorist?
You guys look pretty gay.
[him and his group are not happy about it] Not as gay as us, though.
Oh yeah?! We're super duper triple-dog gay!
Maybe. But you'll never be as metrosexual as us! Come on, fags! [snaps his fingers and his group follows him away]
HA! Told you you guys were straight!
I'm not just gay, I'm a catamite. [Stan, Kyle, Cartman and Kenny stay silent, looking at each other]
[approaches with his friends] Hey, butch boy. Nice football you got there. [they laugh at him]
Oh, here come the butch boys to help their butchy little friend!
Take your non-flaming ass to some other school! [the other boys gather round Kyle and gang up on him]
Everyone knows it's true!
Is so!
[steps forward, past his father] Yeah Mom! We're proud of who we are.
Yeah, little bitch!
Where'd you get those?
Uh-uh, they're not that cool.
Aha! [the three remaining boys quickly face Craig's crew] There you are! You guys thought you were so cool, didn't you?! Well look at what we got! [Craig and his boys present their weapons]
At first we needed our parents' permission, but then we told him our parents were dead.
So, [unsheathes his sword] how would you ninjas like to do battle?
You can't pass through this area until you defend your honor! [Clyde crosses his kamas against each other]
I am not Craig, [twirls his sword] I am Ginza, [transforms] with the powerful blade of the kitana. Iya!
Lose who?
Stuck in his eye? Was he bleeding?
Oh shit, you guys are in trouble. We're outta here!
To hell with that!
Butters!
Butters!
Butters! Where the hell are you?!
[approaches with his boys] You guys! [the other boys turn around] You guys!
It's Butters! We saw 'im!
Right on the other side of the fairgrounds. He's just wandering around aimlessly.
Butters is right on the other side.
[in a monotone voice] No way.
[not wanting to be left out] I believe in Mr. Jefferson!
Yeah!
[on tape, as the name of the show is displayed] Animals Close-Up With A Wide Angle Lens. [the video goes on to show close-ups of dogs and cats.]
[sees the other boys and addresses them] Oh hey guys. Heard about your news show being cancelled.
Yeah, well, I've got an overall deal with the school, heh. They're paying me six dollars a week to come up with new shows.
[throws the gesture back at Stan] This much more than you had!
Hey, a round of root beers for everyone! On me! [the other kids cheer and the waiter opens the lounge. The kids pour into place, including Kenny.]
Hey gang, I brought the new episode of wide angle, close-up animals. [the kids cheer again. Clyde walks up and takes the tape from Craig]
[enters and moves past the other boys] You wanted to see me, Mr. Meryl?
I wouldn't if I were you.
Can't believe it.
Not all that bad? How could you say that?! You hate this game more than any of us!
All the other teams are worse than us.
But who?
He's perfect.
Hey, I hate Cartman too. Can I ignore him with you?
What?
I... don't believe it.
Let's go take it!
He got it! He got the device! [the boys surround Butters]
I wanna use it.
You shut up, asshole.
Maybe we should take it so someplace safer.
You know the rule. No ginger kids in the cafeteria.
Hey, that whale talked to me too. After everyone left the show I walked up to the glass and he started talking.
Well I thought I was crazy. He said my dad was gonna sneak into my room naked one night and beat me up.
...So it's true.
That was it? That was you guys' whole plan? Ask the Russians to take the whale to space?
Dude, a going-away party is supposed to be for the person who is going away!
...But I hate you.
He killed my character right in the middle of a quest!
Got it.
...I don't think that's a very good idea, sir.
[leaves the curtain and puts on his hat] I'm clean! I knew I didn't have any stupid lice! [walks past the rest of the class]
With the lice exam. Did they find anybody with lice? [Clyde looks apprehensive, and Mrs. Garrison notices]
How do we know it was a boy? It could just have easily been one of you stupid girls!
Yeah, come on! We're gonna find out sooner or later.
Yeah. That's true.
You were right all along, Eric. It was Kenny.
Clyde, dude, get down to the park. We caught Kenny, and we're all gonna let him have it! [points to the sock in his right hand]
All right, let's do this!
He had cooties and he lied about it!
I thought I was the only one.
[in admiration] He's the luckiest kid in the world. If I could say "shitballs" to the principal I'd be sooo happy.
If I could say "asspussy" to the counselor I would be sooo happy.
[getting miserable] If I could yell "tampon dickshit" in the classroom I'd be sooo happy.
If I could say "titty sprinkles" on national television I would be sooo happy.
[walks up to Thomas] Wow, you're the coolest kid in the world. If I could call Chris Hansen an asshole-licking dickfart to his face, I would be sooo happy.
Could I just like, hang out with you sometime? Like, do your laundry maybe?
No way.
Dude.
He's not gonna show up to suck your balls dude.

Do you mind, sir? We wanna watch Stan and Kyle play. [Randy stands there a few seconds, disappointed that the boys aren't interested. He takes off the guitar, leans it against the amplifier, and walks away.]
Dude, this game rules.
Dude, what's the matter with him?
Oh man, I can't watch this.
How was that cheating!
They did it!
So who do they say is the cutest?
You're just saying that because you know you're gonna be very last on the list!
You don't think they put the fat tub of lard at the bottom?
We got the list from the girls! [the other boys take pursuit: Stan, Tolkien, Jimmy, Clyde, Tweek, Bill, and two others. Two sixth graders and some kindergartners watch from the far end of the hall]
Whoa, what's this thing? Where am I?
Ah! Look at that! I'm hotter than you, fatso! [he's #12 while Cartman is #15]
Could somebody toss the football back? It's over there next to the ugly kids. [the ugly kids just watch quietly. Kyle is more and more depressed]
Nothing! [everyone laughs harder and looks at Ike.]
[observes] These Pioneer Village workers are really committed to their jobs. [another worker is tied up and put on the chair as the smithy's body is dragged away]
Don't worry, Stan, I don't think the fight's even gonna happen. Cartman said that Wendy's already begging him to call it off.
Then why'd you crap on Garrison's desk?
Okay, that's good, because we moved the fight to first thing in the morning tomorrow.
All right, let's DO IT!
No, it's true. We've always hated you.
[confused] What?
...Fine.
...Yeah.
What do you guys want?
You mean like those guys you see at all the tourist spots?
[assessing the situation] You guys never hang out with me. You never invite me to do stuff. But now you want me to be in a band with you because my grandma gave me a hundred dollars.
[turns right and walks past Cartman] I'll go get the money. [the boys grin. Stan and Kenny high-five each other.]

"Hey, Craig. You know that money your grandma gave you for your birthday? How would you like to invest in a Peruvian flute band? You can double your money in one afternoon. Come on, Craig, don't be an asshole." [some alarms go off for a few seconds, then fall silent as Chertoff appears above the crowd with a blond translator to his left]

Do you guys know why nobody else at school likes hanging out with you? [the other boys look at each other] Because you're always doing stuff like this. You're always coming up with some stupid idea to do something, and then it backfires, and then you end up in some foreign country, or in outer space or something. That's why no one likes hanging out with you guys.
Can we please just go home, sir?

Was there ever a moment when you guys first came up with the genius plan to become a Peruvian flute band that any of you said "Hey, you know? This plan might backfire." [no answer] No, that never occurred to you. Because you guys are jerks, and you never learn from your mistakes, and that's why everyone at school thinks you guys are assholes.
[testing] I'm being a dick?
You guys took my birthday money, got me arrested and sent to Miami with no way home except to take down the country of Peru, and I'm being a dick?
That would be great. Thank you.

My name is Craig Tucker. Last week was my birthday. [a picture of him, his family, and a grandmother standing behind a cake. Ten candles are on the cake. Balloons are all around and a "HAPPY BIRTHDAY" banner is above them] My Grandma gave me a check for a hundred dollars. [a picture of that is shown] I was sooo happy. But then, four kids from school came to my house [a shot of the four boys in Craig's living room] and said I should use my hundred dollars to invest in becoming a Peruvian flute band. [a shot of the newly-formed band, the Llama Brothers] They promised I would double my money in one afternoon. [soldiers swoop in and apprehend them] But the government arrested us along with all the other Peruvian flute bands and took us to an internment camp in Miami. [the camp is shown, followed by the five boys sitting in the interrogation room] We begged to go home, but instead the government told us they were sending us to Peru. [a shot of a DHS cargo plane with the boys sitting on the ground near it.] And so that is now why I'm in Peru. If I die, let it be known that it is because four guys I don't even like from school lied to me and took my birthday money. [he sits on one suitcase, Kenny on another. The whole group is in a mountainous region of Peru]
Oh, that's awesome.
This is fun. Let's walk for miles through a spooky jungle. It just keeps getting better and better.
That's a shock. I decided to follow you guys, and now I'm in the land of the giants lost world.
Stuff just happens.
You just wind up being sent by the government to take down the city of Lima only to wind up in the land of the giants lost world.
You know when stuff happens to most kids? They fall off their bikes. They get in fights with their parents. They get swindled out of their birthday money.
"Let's see what's in there." That's why you guys get into these situations. Because when you come across a spooky, ancient ruin, you say "Let's see what's in there."
What?
I have no idea.
I don't know.
No.
I'm not following you guys any more.
Why?
Every time bad things happen, you guys end up putting yourselves deeper into the middle of it, because "that's just the way it is."
I don't care. I've decided that I'm done. I am choosing not to be a part of this anymore.
It's easy. Watch. [turns around and walks back out the way they came in. He makes his way back to the temple's entrance, and the boys follow him]
No.
...Nope.
Yup, nice and boring. Just the way I like it.
I didn't say anything.

Sir, I promise you, I'm not going to ruin your plans. I'll just walk away. See? [walks onto a square with a pattern on it. The circle in the center of the pattern lights up and begins to rotate up and out. Two stone slabs jut out from the pillar. The golden idol's eyes light up. A beam of light goes from the idol's staff to one of the slabs, and two beams of lightning come out of Craig's eyes and strike the guinea pirate]
Okay, now there's sparks shooting out of my eyes.

My name is Craig Tucker. Last week I stopped a guinea pirate from taking over the earth. All the Peruvian flute bands were released, [a shot of that is shown; happy pan flute musicians] and drove the guinea creatures back to the Andes mountains. [shots from all over are shown, specifically South Park and New York City: pan flute bands are driving the guinea creatures away] Many people had died, but mankind had prevailed. [shots of the cleanup are shown. The Marshes are among the rescued] All over the world, survivors were found, living witnesses to the horror that had been seen.

The guinea pirate lived, but was taken to prison to live out the rest of his days. [the guinea pirate is taken to the Washington D.C. State Penitentiary strapped down to a flatbed truck. Next, a shot of Paris is shown: a Peruvian flute band plays at the Champs Elysées] And people all over the world learned to support their local Peruvian flute bands, and buy their CDs. For they protect us from the guinea creatures. As for me, I was returned home by Homeland Security. [Top Official 1 and Official 3 drop him off and smile at the joyful parents] My parents were sooo happy. [a shot of Craig looking at himself in the mirror, reflecting on the events surrounding his trip to Peru] I realized that we don't always have control over what happens to us. [a shot of Craig in bed, just after bedtime] We are but players on the stage of life. And I also learned to never listen when people come asking you for money. [a shot of the boys dressed as Mariachis standing at Craig's front porch talking to him; he slams the door in their faces.]
Peru.
Yeah, a fifth-grade girlfriend.
I've been waiting for this all week.
Dude, I was here first.
Then just give him half.
I like you Jimmy, but you're not gonna win this. Consider yourself lucky he's only asking for half.
Yep. And if I had wheels, I'd be a wagon.
Just give him half.
That's right. [steps back and hits the ball again. The ball wraps around the pole and hits Butters on the face again. Cartman laughs]
Can we have some food, please? [behind him stand Craig, Kevin, and some more fourth graders]
Tom Saltzman says you don't really have an iPad.
Tom Saltzman says you just glued a piece of glass to an iPad cover and you're faking it. [Cartman looks at him, then looks around to see if anyone is within earshot]
Craig Tucker, 2.4 inches. Yeah, that's about right.
It's awesome.
Oh, that's a good idea.
Please sir, it's very important.
Get out of here.
Slash isn't real. He's a made-up person that represents care and giving, and people dress up like him and lie to their kids.
I didn't hear him coming with all your screaming.
Hey. Hey, I got one. [the other get quiet] Why do girls wear makeup and perfume?
'Cause they're ugly and they stink. [most of the other boys laugh]
Butters is one of those people who you can never remember if he was there or not.
Game on!
Hey, did you guys see Eavesdropper?
Hey, here's a post about Tolkien: "Tolkien Black's Private Gym Photos" [laughs]
Exclusive: Stan Marsh thinks Elise Thompson has a hot butt crack.

"In an email sent yesterday to KENNY McCormick, Stan Marsh wrote 'Dude, you should have been in PE today. Elise Thompson's butt crack was totally showing.' He went on to call her butt crack quote 'nice' and that the whole experience was quote 'pretty awesome'."
[reading off his iPhone] It's not somebody in this room.
Because whoever it is just now posted a new story on Eavesdropper: "Allison Taft reveals embarrassing secret about Craig Tucker." [laughs] Yeah. Hey wait, that's me.
Huh?
It's a rat! [the gerbil noticed them and runs away]
There's no telling. It could be about any of us. [Stan gets off the computer and notices something happening above him as a blinding light appears. The light softens to reveal the Catatafish]
Nothing broke on the Web site yet.
Yeah. We're paying for your being fat.
Yeah, why don't you go home and cry to your stuffed animals again?! [Cartman gasps]
Where's our five dollars?
It said in the e-mail if we came we each got five dollars.
What are you talking about?
Hey, did you see today's newspaper?
You guys made the front page.
Yeah, I can't wait for Sunday.
Jewpa what?
Okay. [to Tolkien and Kenny] So anyways, are they saying what time the event starts?
So then just get a bigger bully to beat the bully up.
Yeah, life sucks sometimes, but it'll pass.
Yeah. Boooo!
Oh, we have a new cheerleader?
Where?
Hey yeah.
Hey Tolkien. If you're gonna get Kyle to video that stuff for you, you should probably tell him the truth.
Cartman's right. If you care about fairness, Stan, then you really have to lose the bracelet.
It just looked like you cut it off, that's all.
We know, Mr. Mackey. We all have our Belarus bracelets too. [the kids raise their arms to prove it]
Whenever I'm confused about what's going on in a movie, I'm always so relieved when Morgan Freeman shows up and explains the plot to me.
He ate it!
Ohhhh.
...The truth about what?
...Aahhhh, no, I don't think so.
...Okay. [next scene, all four of them are on the sofa.]
Aaaaaaaaaaaahh, no.
[slowly reading] Your local DMV is funded by your tax dollars to be efficient and proficient.
I have no idea.
It's true. I walked in on my parents watching Marital Murder Mayhem. They broke the parental lock somehow.
I spent three hours last night trying to get Tweek's parents to stop griefing my castle! When I finally got away from them, I found they had taken all my dandelions!
Where did you find a red-haired cow?
[takes out his phone and starts taking pictures] Wow, that's pretty trippy.
I gotta show this to my mom! [leaves, and the other kids disperse]
Dude, what the hell are you talking about?
Well now he just sounds like a self-righteous asshole.
Black Friday? Come on, that can't be real.
Wait, wait. What are you talking about, XBox Ones? [everyone's smiles vanish]
I thought we were getting Playstation 4's.
Right. Let's all get PS4s.
[angrily] That's exactly how XBox people are!
We're still gonna fight on Black Friday, just not with you!
Everyone who wants to get PS4s, join with us! [Fosse joins Craig and Tweek, followed soon after by Jimmy and two other boys. Bill and Jason join them as well, while Scott joins the XBox group]
Word is that the sixth graders all prefer XBox too, and will team up with Cartman as well.
They're still undecided.
We're just a dying breed, Stan. XBox is going to win this whole thing.

Episode Title: A Song of Ass and Fire
Lines: Wow, Kenny's a Japanese princess.
At Red Robin?
So how do we take over Black Robin?
Haha.
Hey, that could work.
Haha, Butters got asked out by a fat girl.
Hey, Clyde. Nice score, dude.
Yeah, but did you see Tolkien's girlfriend? [flips through the pictures until he gets to Nichole]
What are you guys doing here?
But you told us all to go fuck ourselves.
[keeps pressing] You told us your company was gonna make $10 million, and the rest of us could go fuck ourselves.
Are you guys making this up?
All the pizza we can eat?
All right, this better be good.
You call this a party?! Your party sucks!
I knew you guys were going to bail on the party.
Uh huh, you guys couldn't get Lorde to play, could you?
[with butter on a stick] Well, I gotta admit, you guys throw a pretty sweet party.
[from inside] Occupied.
You can't call dibs on a toilet.
Whoa..
What are you talking about? [Cartman comes into view at the end of the hall and walks towards the boys room]
For what?
Where was all this?
Yeah, it's kind of like when the princess of one country marries the prince of another.
Dude, what the fuck?
Uhh, excuse me, why are you doing this?? [holds up a picture of himself pushing Tweek on a swing, and Tweek enjoying it]
What? Well what did she say?
Why are the Asian girls drawing pictures of us being gay?
But we aren't! I'm not!
But I'm not gay!
No, you may not!
Got a fuckin' problem, man?! [pushes Tweek back]
I told you to stay a hundred yards from me!
Goddammit!
Is Tweek home?
No, thank you, I just want to see Tweek.
Hey dude. [this makes Tweek spit out his coffee, and he gets off his chair]
Tweek, calm down. We have to put a stop to this.
Me too, dude! But there's something we can do.
We have to come out and say we're gay.
Wait. Wait! Because if we're gay, we can break up. And if we break up, no more pictures! We just have to stage a fake breakup in front of the Asian girls.
You can do it, Tweek! You're capable of more than you think.
You just follow my lead, and try and make it believable, okay?
Hey, Tweek! Hold up. Listen, it's just not going to work. [the smiles vanish]
I'm sorry, Tweek, but we can't lie to ourselves anymore. [turns to face the gathering crowd of kids] Yes, we are gay, but we do not belong together.
It's just that people are different. That's all.
What? What are you, what are you talking about?
Wait, uh, that's, that's not what happened.
No. [tries to get Tweek back on track] Uh, look, we both know this is for the better.
Wait, don't make me out to be the bad guy here.
[tries again] You're going too far, dude. This is like, totally not necessary.
This wasn't part of the plan!
Dude, seriously? Seriously?
What do you want?
Dude, I'm not gay and neither are you!
You think you can just pull that shit you pulled at school, saying I step on people and use them?! And I'll just take you back?
Not that real! Now everyone thinks I'm a manipulative cheater! I'll never get any chicks!
I can't be something because everyone wants me to be. I have to be myself. You'll just have to go be gay with someone else.
I wanna see.
We didn't do it.
We're never gonna prove that and you know it! We have to make him stop!
How would we ever get away with it?
Let's just get it over with! [Walks up to Cartman]
We did what we had to do.

Episode Title: The End of Serialization as We Know It
Lines: Why'd you say horrible shit about gay people?
What am I supposed to do?
He's not gonna listen to me. He never does when he's emotional.
[approaches] Tweek.
Dude, come on, you've gotta settle down.
[calmly] We're not all gonna die, you're overreacting. Everything's fine, okay?
Tweek-
Okay, so how about you write your Congressman a letter?
Okay, so write a letter to the North Koreans.
Okay, well why don't you just send something nice to the North Koreans?
It will make you feel better, babe.
I don't know, like... make some croissants or something?
Well, what do you know how to make?
All right, go home and make some cupcakes, honey.
[walks into the kitchen just in time] Tweek, calm down.
Yes, I did see that, so I went and got you something to make things better.
[whips something out of his jacket pocket and shows him] It's a fidget spinner. It's supposed to help with anxiety. [spins it on his finger] See?
[started] Ugh. Wuh. [rubs his eyes and sees who woke him] Hey Tweek.
What time is it, dude?
"North Korea doesn't have the balls to attack Tweek. They have little tiny rice balls."
You've gotta calm down.

[at the same time] Tweek. Tweek. Tweek! [calms down, but is still shaking]' Let's think this through logically. North Korea isn't going to attack anyone, okay? They're not going to start a war they can't win. Okay?
Tweek! You have to stop thinking about it. Tell you what. We're gonna go somewhere fun and make you feel better.
Okay, babe, what do you want to ride first?
We're gonna get your mind off politics and have some fun. Now, what's your favorite ride?
Isn't this lovely, Tweek? Just look at that view!
Oh, come on.
Tweek! Tweek, use your brain! North Korea isn't going to attack an amusement park. You're safer here than anywhere.
It's probably nothing. Everything's fine.
I'm trying to make you feel better.
Okay, but think about that. That actually doesn't make any sense.
Tweek, honey, all week you've been freaking out, and I've been the one forced to deal with it!
Tweek, North Korea isn't bombing anyone. [Tweek turns away and tugs at his hair] They would lose the support of China, and that would mean-

Well, I'm sorry that I'm actually in control of my goddamn emotions, you baby! [stops himself for a few seconds] Oh, see? Now you made me lose control of my emotions. [turns left and walks away] God dammit! [Tweek watches him leave, then grunts louder and louder until it's a full scream]
